title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.14.10 - 11 | 11-11-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras, invoking blessings and paying respects to the spiritual lineage.

segments.key_quote: In this session we will be discussing from the 10th verse of the 14th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam that will be discussed, focusing on Yudhishthira's address to Bhima.

segments.key_quote: Material advancement of civilization means advancement of the reactions of the three four miseries due to celestial influence earthly reactions and bodily or mental pains
segments.summary: The speaker explains the concept of the threefold miseries (tapatraya) - divyaan, bhavmaan, and daihikaan - and how material advancement often leads to increased suffering.

segments.key_quote: Material advancement means advancement of the reactions of the three four miseries
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts modern life with its complications and occupational hazards to a simpler, less problematic past.

segments.key_quote: We are all punished by the laws of nature laws of nature are the same restriction of supreme law we violate we misbehave and therefore we are punished by the laws of nature
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the threefold miseries as punishments from a superior energy (Maya) due to violations of the laws of nature.

segments.key_quote: We have to do our duties but we have to do it being in constant touch with Krishna through devotional service.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of devotional service and Krishna consciousness as a means to find relief from miseries while still performing one's duties.

segments.key_quote: The reaction of material energy is never to be conquered because of the binding effects of the three modes.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the efforts of Asuras to overcome miseries with the insurmountable nature of material energy due to the three modes.

segments.key_quote: But one who surrenders to Krishna can overcome.
segments.summary: The speaker highlights that surrender to Krishna is the way to overcome material energy, and then introduces the science of nimitta, explaining Yudhishthira's experience of physical symptoms.

segments.key_quote: Such miseries can be removed only by the mercy of the Lord who sends his bona fide representatives to enlighten human beings and thus save them from all calamities
segments.summary: The speaker compares undesirable happenings to a forest fire, emphasizing that only the mercy of the Lord, through his representatives like Prabhupada, can save us from calamities, and concludes with the importance of following Prabhupada's teachings.
